title: 111_hr5610
content: The Act titled "Independent Living Centers Technical Adjustment Act" authorizes grants to centers for independent living in states where federal funding exceeds state funding. The Commissioner of the Rehabilitation Services Administration is responsible for distributing funds among these centers in fiscal year 2010. The Act authorizes grants to independent living centers in states where federal funding exceeds state funding. Funds distribution among centers in fiscal year 2010 is determined by the Commissioner of the Rehabilitation Services Administration. In fiscal year 2011 and beyond, funds provided to centers from the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 will be disregarded. In fiscal year 2010, the Commissioner can disregard funds from the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 for independent living centers if a joint request is received from the State by August 5, 2010. In fiscal year 2010, funds from the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 are allocated to existing centers for independent living in states where state funding equals or exceeds federal funding. The Commissioner is not establishing new centers with these funds in the state. In fiscal year 2010, funds from the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 may be distributed among centers for independent living in states based on the proportion of funds allocated in fiscal year 2009. Any funds provided from the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 for the centers for independent living program may be disregarded. In fiscal year 2011 and subsequent years, funds from the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 for centers for independent living may be disregarded.
